`OVault Composer` that automates `IERC4626::deposit()` and `IERC4626::redeem()` operations on a LayerZero transaction.

## Error handling 
1. Failed decode for a malformed `lzCompose` payload [can ONLY refund]
2. Early exit when there the target OFT is not deployed on the dstEid network [can ONLY refund]
3. Exit on slippage [can refund or retry with swap]
4. Not enough `msg.value` to cover t

prs.title: chore: only check if target peer is not set on early exit due to config
prs.truncated_body:
Replacing the `quoteSend()` lz check with `oft.peers(dstEid)` since the other things that can go wrong with `quoteSend()` are like 
1. dvn config (protocol issue that should be fixed)
2. rate limiter consumption (temp issue)
3. etc

Since the protocol has peer set for that EID we know that they want to goto that network

commits.message:
chore: only check if target peer is not set on early exit due to config

prs.title: Feat/ledger latest
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Add a `stellar ledger latest` command to get the latest ledger for the given network. Defaults to testnet.

It also defaults to the `text` output, which looks like this:
```
stellar ledger latest

Sequence: 1468935
Protocol Version: 22
ID: 41a18d68e814201db155ee754c1f4523f899dc31a234cb1d6435030d97ddb94f
```

`--output json` and `--output json-formatted` are also available.

prs.truncated_body:
### Description

This change, add `--postcondition-mode [allow, deny]` option to `blockstack-cli publish` command.

Default mode is `deny`, preserving behaviour before this patch.

It can be used like this:

```
blockstack-cli contract-call \
    ... \
    --postcondition-mode allow
```
### Applicable issues

- fixes #6194 

### Additional info (benefits, drawbacks, caveats)

To

This PR implements the logic to allow Tx Replay to respond to forks while it is in progress.

The relevant tests are those prefixed with tx_replay_with_fork_*. In particular, I want to highlight the following two tests, which demonstrate how an ongoing replay is updated:
- `tx_replay_with_fork_causing_replay_set_to_be_updated`: updates the replay set from the deepest fork.
-

prs.title: Implement automated optimization strategy pipeline
prs.truncated_body:
Replace hardcoded optimization sequence with attribute-driven reflection-based system that discovers and executes optimization strategies based on their StrategyAttribute priority values.

Key improvements:
- Automated strategy discovery using reflection and StrategyAttribute
- Priority-based execution order (highest priority first)
- Robust error handling with graceful degradation
- Compreh

commits.message:
Implement automated optimization strategy pipeline

Replace hardcoded optimization sequence with attribute-driven reflection-based
system that discovers and executes optimization strategies based on their
StrategyAttribute priority values.

Key improvements:
- Automated strategy discovery using reflection and StrategyAttribute
- Priority-based execution order (highest priority first)
- Robust error handling with graceful degradation
- Comprehensive test coverage for automated pipeline
- Maintained backward compatibility with all existing functionality
- Made StrategyAttribute public for reflection access

This resolves the TODO comment in Optimizer.cs and provides a maintainable,
extensible optimization system that automatically incorporates new optimization
strategies as they are added with proper attributes.

All existing compiler tests continue to pass, confirming compatibility.

Apply code formatting to automate-optimizer-strategies-clean implementation

- Run dotnet format to ensure consistent code style
- Clean up automated optimizer strategy implementation
- Maintain proper formatting for reflection-based strategy discovery
- Keep priority-based execution logic intact
